org.microtitan.diffusive.diffuser.restful.resources

Class RestfulClassPathResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microtitan.diffusive.diffuser.restful.resources.RestfulClassPathResource

  • public class RestfulClassPathResource
extends java.lang.Object
    The JAX-RS resource that provides byte[] representations of a specified class. The resource will first attempt to load the Class file as a resource found on the application's class path. If the no Class with that name is found, then it will attempt to load the Class file from the JAR files listed in the classPaths handed to the constructor. The URL should point to a JAR file, and are likely to be a local path. See the RestfulDiffuserManagerResource.createJarClassPath(List) method to create a List of URL from a list of absolute or relative local paths. Examples of paths passed to the RestfulDiffuserManagerResource.createJarClassPath(List) method are:
    • ..\\examples\\example_0.2.0.jar (a relative path on Windows)
    • ../another/example.jar (a relative path on Windows, Unix/Linux, MacOSX)
    • C:/this/is/a/path/to/a/jar.jar (an absolute path on Windows)
    • C:\\this\\is\\another\\jar\\path\\example_0.2.0.jar (an absolute path on Windows)
    • /unix/type/jar/path/example.jar (an absolute path on Unix/Linux, MacOSX)
    • /Users/person/Documents/workspace/examples/example_0.2.0.jar (an absolute path on Unix/Linux, MacOSX)
    On Windows these will be translated to the form
    file:///C:/path/to/jar/file/example.jar
    and on Unix/Linux and MacOSX these will be translated to the form
    file:///path/to/jar/file/example.jar
    Author:
    Robert Philipp
